p: Abdal Dayem et al. [ 89] showed anti-influenza activity of some flavonoid compounds such as diosmetin, eriodictyol, kaempferol, and isorhamnetin along with quercetin isolated from polyphenol extracts. Among these, isorhamnetin showed the most potent antiviral activity, but, quercetin, which was tested in different periods, also caused suppression of influenza virus-induced cell death. They evaluated the effects of isorhamnetin and quercetin both in 50 ÂµM concentration in pre- and cotreatments. In a virus yield reduction assay, quercetin led to a significant decrease in virus titer [ 89].
